name: Furama RiverFront

reviews.text: I stayed at Furama Riverfront in January 2013 and had a great experience. The staff were very friendly and provided excellent customer service. The location was very good with all taxis knowing where the hotel was and most attractions (Gardens by the bay, Singapore flyer) only a 10/15min taxi trip away. We (3 people) stayed in a deluxe room and were very happy that they provided 3 single beds instead of 2 doubles. The room was very neat and clean and the complementary water added a nice touch, especially with Singapore's weather! The bathroom was clean but a little outdated but that didn't really matter to us. We booked the room with breakfast which was very good with a wide variety of foods from all around the world. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely stay at Furama Riverfront again.
reviews.title: Furama Riverfront Hotel Experience

reviews.text: I stay at the Furoma for two nights. The hotel is beautiful and has excellent amenities and it is well located. The Buffet style restaurant offer excellent cuisine. Breakfast is delicious. It doesn't offer free Wifi.
reviews.title: Excellent Service. Perfect Location

reviews.text: I stayed at Furama Riverfront for 3 nights in Jan 2013, and had a very good experience. The staff was very good - more friendly than any other hotel I have stayed in Singapore. The room was very good, neat, clean and everything you would like for a comfortable stay. The executive lounge was excellent and so was the breakfast with options for all tastes. The location is excellent as well, with Clarke Quay just a 10 -15 minute walk by the river.
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would surely recommend this to anyone travelling to Singapore - solos as well as families.
reviews.title: Executive package a waste

reviews.text: We found an exceptional rate for an "executive room deal" at this hotel on Agoda so we really can't complain too much. For Singapore the rates at this hotel are very good, however I was a little disappointed in the room and inclusions. My partner actually like it but I have stayed many times before in their "tropical rooms" and actually prefer those.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel - Outstanding

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as part of Singapore stopover. We found the hotel to be basic but Ok. We arrived early in the morning but were still allowed to check in to our room which was great after a 12 hour flight. The room was OK , maybe could have been a little bit cleaner but it was what I had expected for the price. Had to leave early so can't comment on breakfast, We had the buffet lunch which was quite nice. Staff seemed friendly especially towards our 2 young children and they made a big fuss of them which was nice.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: The Furama Riverfront just ticks the okay box. The gawdy fake flowers "decorating" the lobby look like they have seen better days as does a lot of the decor and furnishings. I agree with many other reviewers the beds are extra firm; which is better than suffering through many nights on those terrible saggy beds, but yes, I had sore ribs and hips. We stayed on the 12th floor unrenovated and the shower was pretty awful. One had to be pretty dexterous to climb over the bathtub and be careful not to slip as the skinny tub tends to drain too slowly and fill with water. In addition, one tends to end up with a very wet bathroom floor afterwards. When toileting one gets a close up view of all the spots the housekeepers miss in their cleaning; under the soap shelf in the shower and around the basin were covered in mould. And it was hard to see out of the windows because they were so dirty. But hey, it's an old hotel at a reasonable price, maybe they can just pay a little more attention to detail. The breakfast buffet was okay, but once again, just a little more attention to detail; spoons in water, soggy pastries, and bad coffee. As an Australian I love nothing more than bacon and eggs for breakfast but I could not warm to the funky flavour of the "Beef Bacon". I assume this is for their many Malay and Muslim customers. So I tended to go for the Malay breakfast of curry and rice. The chefs always seem to do their local food the best; I recommend stick to that.
reviews.title: A bit tired and a bit grubby, and I don't mean me.
Not so nice
reviews.text: It might be nice if the lobby staff were a little warmer and welcoming, as in most hotels you do get a good feeling walking in but not the Furama.

reviews.title: Average hotel.
reviews.text: On the upside the hotel was pretty close to Chinatown (about a 15 minute walk) and we found the taxi services cheap easy and reliable.

It's just so-so in every aspect. The location can't be easily reached by public transport, no store surrounded. For wifi we have to pay quite high, tv channel is poor. I'd rather stay in budget hotel where accessibility is good, free wifi, and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good location and interior

reviews.text: We were very surprised to arrive and find out that our 2 rooms were upgraded to the Executive Floor, which meant that we were also able to enjoy the Executive Lounge and it's generous offerings. The rooms were surprisingly luxurious and we also enjoyed our walks near the hotel.
reviews.title: First Stay at Furama Riverfront Hotel

reviews.text: Unfortunately our breakfasts were not included, but that was our choice due to the cost factor. The pool and outdoor area was also lovely and service good.
reviews.title: Not so good of an experience

reviews.text: I just checked in few mins ago. Not a good start. Checking in took 45 mins!!. No apologies for long wait. Everything from my side were in order. It took the receptionist that long to locate my reservation. To do that she asked me to send my booking details by forwarding it to her. Luckily, I had Internet for my iPad I got at the airport which came in handy. I gave my iPad to her and asked her to forward the confirmation email to whatever address she wanted. After 15-20 mins she came back saying, she sent it to a wrong address! Now, I sent it to the correct address. Finally, booking is confirmed. What a relief!!
reviews.title: Cosy and worthy stay

reviews.text: Then,the receptionist next to my receptionist was asking the guests, what room they would like, how many keys etc...I wasn't asked any thing!! She just handed over the key and asked me to go to my room by turning right on the slope!!
reviews.title: Good Alternative in Singapore

reviews.text: Usually,the front desk gives some other valuable info or guide guests to concierge etc. none of that sort happened here!!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In light of the other TA reviews I was expecting better. This is not going to be a good review but I always aim to give an honest review. By the way I have raved about some hotels. If they are good they are good if not well I'll tell it as it is.
reviews.title: not as good as I was expecting

reviews.text: I stayed in a non smoking standard room no 918. First impression large clean tidy room and nice clean bathroom, generous toiletries, so far really good.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, location not so great

reviews.text: The bed felt firm and seemed comfy but after the 2nd night we both woke up with sore shoulder/neck area, so did some of the other guests we met. We all found the bed was actually too firm.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great value for money!
average service to host a conference
reviews.text: Every night around 11pm we could hear the music, thump, thump, thump from the night club next door, I was so tired each night I still fell asleap despite this but if I woke in the night It was hard to ignore it.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!
reviews.text: The water gushing down the pipes between the rooms. It was fine in the early evening but if you were unlucky like we were and someone upstairs or next door wanted to take a 30 min shower late at night ( it went on for so long we genuinely thought there must have been a burst water pipe and called reception). It was so noisy we could not fall asleap until it had finally stopped. Again others we spoke to also experienced this. Fortunatly this only kept us awake on the last 2 nights.

description: Furama RiverFront was voted Best Mid-Range Hotel 2011, Asia Pacific in the TTG Travel Awards for 3 years running in 2009, 2010 and 2011. This well-appointed 4-star business hotel comprises 605 rooms, 2 restaurants, a lounge, 10 function rooms and an Executive Lounge. There are also leisure facilities such as a tennis court, putting green, swimming pool with outdoor jacuzzi and a fitness centre in the hotel for guests to unwind and relax.Located right by the Central and Ayer Rajah Expressways, the hotel is easily accessible to major tourist attractions, the Central Business District and is just 5 minutes’ drive from Orchard Road. Head for Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay - the vibrant nightlife and entertainment belt along the river – situated in very close proximity to the hotel.
